engine.math

Class MathException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • engine.math.MathException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MathException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    This exception can be thrown in any situation where an error would arise from mathematics. In particular, this exception is thrown from the BoundingBox class if the width and height are set to negative numbers.
    Author:
    Michael
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MathException(java.lang.Object badMaths)
      Constructs a MathException instance with the default error message "Mathematically impossible: " + badMaths.
      MathException(java.lang.String message)
      Constructs a MathException instance with a custom error message.
      MathException(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Object badMaths)
      Constructs a MathException instance with a custom error message.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object getBadObj()
      Gets the object representing the math error that occurred.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MathException

        public MathException(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Object badMaths)
        Constructs a MathException instance with a custom error message. Note the actual error message will be message + " " + badMaths.
        Parameters:
        message - a String to decorate the maths.
        badMaths - an object representing the math error that occurred.

      • MathException

        public MathException(java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a MathException instance with a custom error message. Note getBadObj() will return null if constructed in this way.
        Parameters:
        message - a String to represent the math error that occurred.

      • MathException

        public MathException(java.lang.Object badMaths)
        Constructs a MathException instance with the default error message "Mathematically impossible: " + badMaths.
        Parameters:
        badMaths - an object representing the math error that occurred.

    • Method Detail

      • getBadObj

        public java.lang.Object getBadObj()
        Gets the object representing the math error that occurred. This could be an Integer or String or something else.
        Returns:
        the object representing the math error that occurred.
